titleStmt.title: An oration of Ihon Fabritius Montanus VVherby he teacheth that Christian men cannot resorte to the Councel of Trent, without committing an haynous offence. Englyshed by L.A.
titleStmt.author: Fabricius, Joannes, Montanus, 1527-1566.

titleStmt.title: An oration of Ihon Fabritius Montanus VVherby he teacheth that Christian men cannot resorte to the Councel of Trent, without committing an haynous offence. Englyshed by L.A.
titleStmt.author: Fabricius, Joannes, Montanus, 1527-1566.
L. A., fl. 1562.

editionStmt.edition: Newelye set forth and allowed, accordynge to the order appoynted in the Quenes Maiestyes Iniunctions. Anno. 1.5.62.

publicationStmt.publisher: In Powles Churcheyard by [J. Cawood for] Humfrie Toye, dwellynge at the sygne of the Helmet],

notesStmt.note: Imprint from colophon. Printer's name from STC.
Cawood's initials, "IC", are in a factotum at the bottom of the title page--STC.
Running title reads: An oration agaynst the Councel of Trent.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
